name: Scandic Marski Hotel

reviews.text: We arrived in Helsinki having travelled from Tallinn by jetfoil. The hotel is a short walk from the ferry terminal and is very central.
reviews.title: Excellent location, friendly staff
Scandic Marski: A 3 Star that should be a 4 Star
reviews.text: The hotel is starting to look a little dated, but remains comfortable

reviews.title: Righnt in the centre of everything

reviews.text: Free, unlimited wi-fi is available throughout the hotel. Hilton Honor
reviews.title: Best in our 3 city trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: members are provided with free bottled water and fruit which is available in reception (remember, if you're not a member, it's free to sign up at hilton.com).
reviews.title: Great location, nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The place was spotless. The breakfast was excellent with lovely organic choices & fresh fruit etc. The location couldn't have been any better, you fall out the front door and are within walking distance from lots of shops and restaurants. Good value compared to other prices in Helsinki, would definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: A very nice hotel!
Good Hotel--Great Location
reviews.text: Very nice Hotel in Central Helsinki. Great location can walk or take a short taxi ride to most sites. If you are from the US you should book a larger room. The small business/economy rooms are acceptable for Europeans but do not live up to the expectations of US travelers.
The free breakfest buffet is excellant!
reviews.title: Free bikes

likes.disliked: — smoky smell in room, floodyng bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have 2 cute red bikes to rent out for free- i took a ride at night to Kaivopuisto, that was just excellent, very good bikes! Other than that: great location, rich breakfast, comfortable beds. Seems to be a hotel for businessmen - 90% of guests were men in suits. Only problem I had was in the bathroom - after showering it flooded all over to the toilet.
reviews.title: Not As Described But Maybe The Fault Of Otel.com

reviews.text: We had a pleasant enough stay at the Scandic and it is very well located, but it wasn't as described on the packet!! otel.com describe it as a luxury 5 star hotel and at best it is a high 3. Our main criticism was the low standards of cleanliness (unusual in Finland )- it's tired and frayed round the edges - but as it is quite austere, it is not quite like a pair of comfy old slippers.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Super location for this perfectly good hotel. You are literally in the middle of Helsinki, a short walk from pretty much everything, and right on a tram stop if not. Staff helpful, and rooms perfectly acceptable. Would recommend.
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — Distance from front entrance to room was exceedingly long

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best part of hotel is location—in the heart of everything in central Helsinki. Hotel divided into two parts: Main building (1960's or 70's?) and a much older annex that is connected by a long hallway and connector. I stayed in older building in a spacious 2-bed room – high ceilings and wood parquet floor. Bedding was good. Tub is very high and not ideal for seniors or those with difficulty moving legs. Great breakfast buffet. I also had a good meal at the restaurant. I appreciated the sauna but there are very limited hours in the morning and evening. The staff were always accommodating. Don’t expect effusive responses from them. . . they’re Finnish!
reviews.title: very good stay

likes.disliked: — the staff not the most friendly Ive come across

reviews.text: I have been to this hotel twice on business and find the location excellent. The trams run from virtually outside the hotel. The bedrooms are a good size and the bathroom is a large wet room. I have only used the restaurant for breakfast and have no complaints, set me up for the day. The staff are very friendly, Finns in general are.
reviews.title: City Centre Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stockmann's is a short walk from the hotel if you are looking for gifts, similar to Macy's. Take a walk down to the harbour and visit the Russian Orthodox Church. Lots of cafés and restaurants on the Esplanade. Helsinki is one of my favourite city's, very modern but with an old world feel.
reviews.title: Solid Value

reviews.text: Great Breakfast, Sauna, and Bed. Be sure to check the rates before using the in-room telephone.
reviews.title: Good location, good staff, good everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I admit that if even a small thing is not up to standard at any hotel I stay at then I make sure they know about it. I've had countless bottles of wine (which I like) and some bowing and scraping (which I don't) over the years.
reviews.title: So Central

reviews.text: No wine for me at this hotel. Absolutely no complaints at all. All the staff I dealt with were very pleasant, right from check-in when I was asked if I needed internet access and was given passwords for each of the three days of my stay. Nice that I didn't have to ask. And the wireless service in the room was fast and efficient. There are also two terminals, with printers, in the lobby.
reviews.title: Great hotel

description: Centrally located Hotel in a modern multi-story building in the center of shopping & business district.
